question.short: Does weight training prevent height growth?
question.long: Does weight training prevent height growth?

description: Results from studies evaluating the impact of weight training on height growth in children and adolescents.

no_consensus.description: The literature has not yet reached a consensus on the effects of weight training on height growth

no.description: The literature suggests that weight training does not prevent height growth

towards_no.description: The literature suggests that weight training probably doesn't prevent height growth, but more research is needed

towards_yes.description: The literature suggests that weight training may prevent height growth, but more research is needed

yes.description: The literature suggests that weight training prevents height growth

no.description: The results of the paper show no significant effect of weight training on height growth

no_unlike_literature.description: The results of the paper show no significant effect of weight training on height growth, unlike what is reported in the literature

no_but_mixed_results.description: The results of the paper show no significant overall effect of weight training on height growth, but there are mixed results on specific cases

maybe.description: The results of the paper suggest that weight training might have an effect on height growth, but the evidence is not strong enough to conclude

yes_but_low_confidence.description: The results of the paper suggest that weight training may prevent height growth, but the evidence is not strong

yes_but_small_effect.description: The results of the paper suggest that weight training may have a small effect on height growth

yes_unlike_literature.description: The results of the paper suggest that weight training may prevent height growth, unlike what is reported in the literature

yes.description: The results of the paper suggest that weight training prevents height growth

papers.title: The effects of hydraulic resistance strength training in pre-pubertal males
papers.quote: Both groups increased in height and weight during the 14 wk. Although a trend for greater growth rate was observed in the strength training group, a significant two-way interaction was not observed for height

papers.title: Strength training for prepubescent males: Is it safe?
papers.quote: Results showed that in the short term, supervised concentric strength training results in a low injury rate and does not adversely affect bone, muscle, or epiphyses ; nor does it adversely affect growth, development, flexibility, or motor performance

papers.title: The Effects of Upper Body Resistance Training on Prepubescent Children
papers.quote: There was a tendency for the experimental group toward greater height gain

papers.title: Strength training effects in prepubescent boys
papers.quote: There were no significant differences in age, height, weight, sum of two skinfolds, or percent body fat between the experimental and control groups initially or after training

papers.title: Resistance Training During Preadolescence
papers.quote: Short term resistance training appears to have no effect on somatic growth (height or weight)

papers.title: The Effects of a Twice-A-Week Strength Training Program on Children
papers.quote: Significant main effects for time, indicative of growth, were noted for height and weight following the training period

papers.title: The Effects of Strength Training and Detraining on Children
papers.quote: There were no significant differences in height or weight between groups either before or after the training and detraining periods

papers.title: Youth resistance training: position statement paper and literature review
papers.quote: Despite the old myth that resistance training will stunt the statural growth of children, current observations indicate that youth resistance training (up to 20 weeks) will not have an adverse effect on growth patterns

papers.title: The Effect of Long-Term Resistance Training on Anthropometric Measures, Muscle Strength, and Self Concept in Pre-Pubertal Boys
papers.quote: No differences were observed in the gain in body height between groups

papers.title: Effects of resistance training on protein utilization in healthy children
papers.quote: During the investigation, significant increases in weight, height, FFM, FM, and body mass index were noted

papers.title: Resistance training, skeletal muscle and growth.
papers.quote: Scientific evidence indicates that resistance training results in increased serum IGF-I and that there is no detrimental effect on linear growth

papers.title: Effects of Resistance Training on the Physical Capacities of Adolescent Soccer Players
papers.quote: Significant main effects were observed for height and weight, but no differences were found between groups

papers.title: Weight Training in Youth-Growth, Maturation, and Safety: An Evidence-Based Review
papers.quote: Resistance training programs do not influence growth in height and weight of pre- and early-adolescent youth

papers.title: Resistance Training for Children and Adolescents
papers.quote: Scientific evidence indicates that there is no detriment of youth resistance training on linear growth in children and adolescents

papers.title: Canadian Society for Exercise Physiology position paper: resistance training in children and adolescents
papers.quote: Data suggest that regular participation in a well-designed RT program does not negatively impact growth or maturation of youth. Traditional fears associated with youth RT have been replaced with more recent findings that indicate that regular participation in weightbearing physical activities is essential for normal bone growth and development

papers.title: Strength Training by Children and Adolescents

institution.name: Council on Sports Medicine and Fitness

papers.quote: Appropriate strength-training programs have no apparent adverse effect on linear growth

papers.title: Strength Training Recommendations for the Young Athlete
papers.quote: Data suggest that regular participation in a well-designed RT program does not negatively impact growth or maturation of youth

papers.title: Resistance training among young athletes: safety, efficacy and injury prevention effects
papers.quote: There is no evidence that resistance training will negatively impact growth in height during childhood and adolescence

papers.title: Strength Training in Children and Adolescents: Raising the Bar for Young Athletes?
papers.quote: A well-designed strength training program following the recommended loads, sets, and repetitions appropriate for the young athlete‚Äôs age and body habitus should not excessively stress growth plates [...] while favorably influencing bone growth and development in youth by increasing bone mineral density

papers.title: Youth Resistance Training: Updated Position Statement Paper From the National Strength and Conditioning Association
papers.quote: There is no detrimental effect of resistance training on linear growth in children and adolescents

papers.title: Pediatric Resistance Training: Benefits, Concerns, and Program Design Considerations
papers.quote: There is no evidence to suggest that resistance training will negatively impact growth and maturation during childhood and adolescence

papers.title: Position statement on youth resistance training: the 2014 International Consensus
papers.quote: No scientific evidence indicates that resistance training will have an adverse effect on linear growth during childhood or adolescence or reduce eventual height in adulthood

papers.title: There is No Need to Avoid Resistance Training (Weight Lifting) until Physeal Closure
papers.quote: Just as many studies have shown that resistance training is not acutely dangerous to a youthful physis, there is limited clinical evidence that suggests weight lifting does not alter linear growth in the short term

papers.title: Treinamento de For√ßa para Crian√ßas: Uma Metan√°lise Sobre Altera√ß√µes do Crescimento Longitudinal, For√ßa e Composi√ß√£o Corporal
papers.quote: The level of longitudinal growth was also superior in the experimental groups. Therefore, this research suggests that RT as an intervention for favorable gains in strength, muscle hypertrophy and longitudinal growth in individuals over seven to 12 years

papers.title: Resistance training for children and adolescents
papers.quote: In the past, it was thought RT was detrimental to youth athletes [...] resulting in concern for increased physeal injuries and the potential for stunted growth. Multiple studies have since discredited this theory by demonstrating there is no adverse effects of RT in youth athletes, when designed properly

papers.title: Resistance Training in Youth Improves Athletic Performance: A Systematic Review
papers.quote: In addition, there has been no documented detrimental effect of appropriately designed resistance training programs on linear growth in children and adolescents

papers.title: Effects of physical activity on children's growth
papers.quote: Physical exercise does not appear to impair the child‚Äôs linear growth and contributes to the ideal shaping of bone and muscle tissues, ensuring possible beneficial effects throughout life

papers.title: Resistance Training for Children and Adolescents
papers.quote: Appropriately designed resistance training programs have no apparent negative effect on linear growth

papers.title: Weightlifting for Children and Adolescents: A Narrative Review
papers.quote: There was no evidence that weightlifting training "stunted" growth
